intro: Pokornya ettingshausenii, commonly known as the Ettlinghausen's pokornya, is a rare and distinctive member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
